oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leroy M. Sullivan correspondence with Grady M. Long, undated
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Sullivan, Leroy M., 1921-1943
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Letter from Leroy Sullivan to Grady Long in which Sullivan describes his new interest in poetry, particularly those penned by A. E. Houseman. Sullivan quotes a portion of The Recruit and proclaims that Harvards (training planes) are fun to fly, despite the dangerous mechanical issues that he and the other pilots are experiencing.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Basic training (Military education); T-6 (Training plane); English poetry--20th century; Soldiers -- United States -- History -- 20th century; World War, 1939-1945
Housman, A. E. (Alfred Edward), 1859-1936; Sullivan, Leroy M., 1921-1943
Canada. Royal Canadian Air Force; Great Britain. Royal Air Force. Squadron 56
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:spatial: Royal Air Force Station, Martlesham Heath (Suffolk)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Leroy M. Sullivan correspondence with Grady M. Long, 1941-1943
Leroy M. Sullivan diaries and correspondence
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Leroy M. Sullivan World War II diaries and correspondence
